body_html:
Sorry for not being clear enough. I meant use the tutorial code from 0.12 branch if you're using tf 0.12. or above. https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r0.12/tensorflow/models/rnn/ptb/ I had replaced the tf.strided_slice with tf.slice as well, but I guess there are some additional changes to be made .
…
On 23-Jan-2017 8:03 PM, "John Larkin" ***@***.***> wrote: Hey, No, unfortunately I already made the change from tf.strided_slice to tf.slice, so I don’t think it’s that. Do you have any other suggestions? I really appreciate the help! Are you saying you used version 0.12.0 instead of 0.12.1? Because that would be helpful and I can just use that version perhaps. All the best, John From: Rudraksh Tuwani ***@***.***> Reply-To: tensorflow/tensorflow ***@***.***> Date: Monday, January 23, 2017 at 9:16 AM To: tensorflow/tensorflow ***@***.***> Cc: John Larkin ***@***.***>, Comment < ***@***.***> Subject: Re: [tensorflow/tensorflow] ptb_rnn_lm.py error:tensorflow.python. framework.errors.InvalidArgumentError: logits and labels must have the same first dimension, got logits shape [400,10000] and labels shape [420] (#6469) Using code from 0.12 master branch fixed it for me. I think it is something to do with replacing. tf.strided_slice with tf.slice. On 23-Jan-2017 7:35 PM, "John Larkin" ***@***.***> wrote: > Did anyone figure out a fix for this? I am also having the mismatches > shape issue, off by 420 to 400. Thanks so much! > > — > You are receiving this because you commented. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/ 6469#issuecomment-274495625>, > or mute the thread > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ APnrjBIr98CCAiNLMNMpNlOqH65Q3Kqhks5rVLOogaJpZM4LUnZK> > . > — You are receiving this because you commented. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread. — You are receiving this because you commented. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#6469 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/APnrjJyV_XhwUHE7eZsHQ2mehft3-BJKks5rVLpWgaJpZM4LUnZK> .
body_text:
Sorry for not being clear enough.

I meant use the tutorial code from 0.12 branch if you're using tf 0.12. or
above.
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r0.12/tensorflow/models/rnn/ptb/



I had replaced the  tf.strided_slice with tf.slice as well, but I guess
there are some additional changes to be made .
…
On 23-Jan-2017 8:03 PM, "John Larkin" ***@***.***> wrote:
 Hey,



 No, unfortunately I already made the change from tf.strided_slice to
 tf.slice, so I don’t think it’s that.  Do you have any other suggestions? I
 really appreciate the help!



 Are you saying you used version 0.12.0 instead of 0.12.1? Because that
 would be helpful and I can just use that version perhaps.



 All the best,

 John



 From: Rudraksh Tuwani ***@***.***>
 Reply-To: tensorflow/tensorflow ***@***.***>
 Date: Monday, January 23, 2017 at 9:16 AM
 To: tensorflow/tensorflow ***@***.***>
 Cc: John Larkin ***@***.***>, Comment <
 ***@***.***>
 Subject: Re: [tensorflow/tensorflow] ptb_rnn_lm.py error:tensorflow.python.
 framework.errors.InvalidArgumentError: logits and labels must have the
 same first dimension, got logits shape [400,10000] and labels shape [420]
 (#6469)



 Using code from 0.12 master branch fixed it for me.

 I think it is something to do with replacing. tf.strided_slice with
 tf.slice.

 On 23-Jan-2017 7:35 PM, "John Larkin" ***@***.***> wrote:

 > Did anyone figure out a fix for this? I am also having the mismatches
 > shape issue, off by 420 to 400. Thanks so much!
 >

body:
Sorry for not being clear enough.

I meant use the tutorial code from 0.12 branch if you're using tf 0.12. or
above. 
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r0.12/tensorflow/models/rnn/ptb/



I had replaced the  tf.strided_slice with tf.slice as well, but I guess
there are some additional changes to be made .

On 23-Jan-2017 8:03 PM, "John Larkin" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Hey,
>
>
>
> No, unfortunately I already made the change from tf.strided_slice to
> tf.slice, so I don’t think it’s that.  Do you have any other suggestions? I
> really appreciate the help!
>
>
>
> Are you saying you used version 0.12.0 instead of 0.12.1? Because that
> would be helpful and I can just use that version perhaps.
>
>
>
> All the best,
>
> John
>
>
>

> framework.errors.InvalidArgumentError: logits and labels must have the
> same first dimension, got logits shape [400,10000] and labels shape [420]
> (#6469)
>
>
>
> Using code from 0.12 master branch fixed it for me.
>
> I think it is something to do with replacing. tf.strided_slice with
> tf.slice.

> > Did anyone figure out a fix for this? I am also having the mismatches
